messages: 22262772675b116ae5c7a50d3e51ff04 (20:45): Is there the tool,can reverse the .h .cpp files to .ui files?

41aad8e47d7858c66cd367fc9a59724c (20:46): qmake question: in my .pro file.. a few source files have the same name but are in different directories of the entire project.. but since qmake puts all the .o files in one place, it conflicts.   Is there a way to have it sort out the .o files a little better?
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (20:47): dont use subdirs
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (20:47): or use them for diferent projects
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (20:47): but dont put one project in diefernt dirs
41aad8e47d7858c66cd367fc9a59724c (20:48): can I have my master qmake project file call qmake&&make for the sub project files?
41aad8e47d7858c66cd367fc9a59724c (20:49): can a single .pro file build multiple targets?
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (20:49): teh same time?
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (20:50): or have mutliple targets
41aad8e47d7858c66cd367fc9a59724c (20:50): ya.. multiple targets in same pro file
41aad8e47d7858c66cd367fc9a59724c (20:50): so it might build two libs, then an app
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (20:50): aah TARGET
41aad8e47d7858c66cd367fc9a59724c (20:50): separate files then
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (20:50): use pro files in the subdirs
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (20:55): can some acknowledge mingw creates broken executeables with this package? http://exys.org/kram/sefgf.tgz
86ec5627dfe80cac1a06bc97c23bb800 (21:06): aep, "too many fingers error" seems more likely than Mingw building broken executables.   but yes, it fails on my system with mingw
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (21:11): [18:07] <aep> actualy ntdll fails to manage the links
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (21:11): [18:07] <aep> i snet  abug to trolltech. i dont think its their fault, but i dunno who will care if not they
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (21:11): got disconnected
86ec5627dfe80cac1a06bc97c23bb800 (21:11): the problem is with windows
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (21:12): they will say its my fault if i use gpl software instead of their own toolset
86ec5627dfe80cac1a06bc97c23bb800 (21:12): if you google a bit it usually says that the permissions for some DLL file is not set properly and thats what causes it
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (21:12): i know its the ntddl what segfaults and it shouldnt and print the error instead
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (21:12): no its not a permission problem. i researched very deep into it
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (21:13): 0x00005 means normaly permission indeed
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (21:13): but its the ntddll that segfaults on trying to find QObject::metaData
1f00490ca8bb9114a78573d2b8a21836 (21:17): there isn't anything called QObject::metaData
1f00490ca8bb9114a78573d2b8a21836 (21:18): perhaps you mean QObject::staticMetaObject?
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (21:18): exactly this
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (21:18): i know its not exisitng
86ec5627dfe80cac1a06bc97c23bb800 (21:19): eh... as i said, "too many fingers error"
86ec5627dfe80cac1a06bc97c23bb800 (21:19): you have Q_OBJECT in your qxtreewidget, but you have no slots nor signals
86ec5627dfe80cac1a06bc97c23bb800 (21:19): remove it and your app will work.
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (21:19): are you serious?
86ec5627dfe80cac1a06bc97c23bb800 (21:19): yeah
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (21:20): there are just no signals and slots beocuse i took them out for testing
86ec5627dfe80cac1a06bc97c23bb800 (21:20): well there isnt even any code in it, i dont know what its supposed to do. remove qobject macro and it will fire up nicely though
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (21:21): it does nothing. its a testcase
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (21:21): and i need the Q_Object in real world use
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (21:23): booting my windows box. lets see if you are right
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (21:24): in the library or the executeable?
86ec5627dfe80cac1a06bc97c23bb800 (21:24): what you mean?
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (21:25): where should i take it out? library or executable?
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (21:25): did you actualy compile thze library?
86ec5627dfe80cac1a06bc97c23bb800 (21:25): in the librari.  i figured problem was in the DLL and that this was it cause there was no signals nor slots
86ec5627dfe80cac1a06bc97c23bb800 (21:25): library*
86ec5627dfe80cac1a06bc97c23bb800 (21:26): yeah.. app is running here.   small framed window with white background and a tree item with text "1" and its draggable.
86ec5627dfe80cac1a06bc97c23bb800 (21:26): but awh sorry :S
86ec5627dfe80cac1a06bc97c23bb800 (21:26): i just added a signal and put qobject back and now it crashes again .O
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (21:27): but good that you found out its the QObject
021b7bf3ff2076c746a1ed6f90658a06 (21:28): one step closer
